intro: Caralluma framesii, commonly known as the horned nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of India and Pakistan. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its succulent, spiny stems and small, fleshy leaves. The plant produces yellow or orange flowers that bloom at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Its unique morphology and adaptations to harsh environments make it a notable species in desert ecosystems. Caralluma framesii is also sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
